quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fear and Term
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, thanatophobia, condition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Thanatophobia is a condition, characterized by an abnormal fear of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death

questions.question: The fear of women is called hierophobia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What does the e.e. in the name, e.e. cummings stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward Estlin

questions.question: Which of these most accurately describes the school of Thomism?

options.text: The attempt to unify protestantism and Catholicism
The attempt to unify Aristotles ideas with those of the Bible
The attempt to unify Newtons mechanics and quantum mechanics
The attempt to unify quantum mechanics and general relativity

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The attempt to unify Aristotles ideas with those of the Bible

questions.question: Belonephobia is the irrational fear of needles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: A person who is excessively afraid of getting married suffers from what phobia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gamophobia

questions.question: Which of these words means  gloomy, dark, sadly dim?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: tenebrous

questions.question: Acrophobia is a term, defined as an excessive fear of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heights

questions.question: The fear of high objects, drafts, and air-swallowing is known as rhodophobia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled in 1972, that capital punishment was unconstitutional.  What was the name of the case?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gregg v. Georgia

questions.question: This medical term is defined as the abnormal fear of darkness, and commonly experienced by children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nyctophobia

questions.question: What medical term defines the fear of eating?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phagophobia

questions.question: People suffering from graphophobia are afraid of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Writing

questions.question: What term stands for the excessive fear of snakes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ophidiophobia

questions.question: Which of these is a genuine mathematical principle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pigeon Hole Principle

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Monster and Drugs
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, deaths, lundgren. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What name was given to the monster created in Mary Shelleys classic novel subtitled The Modern Prometheus?

options.text: The monster didnt have a name.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The monster didnt have a name.

questions.question: What famous Israeli liqueur comes in a genie shaped bottle and has a distinctive chocolate/orange flavor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sabra

questions.question: Located in the Northwest Territories, what lake empties into the Mackenzie River and is considered the largest lake that is entirely within Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Bear Lake

questions.question: This heavy metal has the symbol Pb. It is a poisonous neurotoxin that can cause brain and blood disorders.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lead

questions.question: What first full admiral of the Navy, uttered the famous phrase, Damn the torpedoes, full speed ahead!, during the American Civil War at the Battle of Mobile Bay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Farragut

questions.question: Most heroin-related deaths are not caused by an overdose but by a lethal combination with other drugs in the body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Named after a 19th century British surgeon and anatomist, the Bowmans capsule is located in which organ/s of the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kidneys

questions.question: What is the name for a layer of gasses that surround a large object and are held in place by the objects gravity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atmosphere

questions.question: Born Charles Dennis Buchinsky in 1921, this The Dirty Dozen and Rider on the Rain actor was known in Italy as Il Brutto (The Ugly One).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Bronson

questions.question: Although almost non-existent today, what ancient religion, stemming predominantly from Persia, worshipped Ahura Mazda as an uncreated Creator and God.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zoroastrianism

questions.question: Which 1951 Tony winner for Best Musical had its music and lyrics written by Frank Loesser and included such characters as Nathan Detroit, Miss Adelaide, and Sky Masterson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guys and Dolls

questions.question: Actors Dolph Lundgren, Lena Olin, and Ann Margaret hail from this Scandinavian country that joined the European Union in 1995.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweden

questions.question: After gaining 30 pounds and donning a set of prosthetic teeth, Charlize Theron teamed up with Christina Ricci and won a 2003 Academy Award for Best Actress in the biographical, crime, thriller movie titled Monster. What real life serial killer and prostitute did Charlize portray in this film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aileen Wournos

questions.question: Name the creator of The Prelude, who was the Poet Laureate in England from 1843 to 1850 and comprised a group known as the Lake Poets with Samuel Taylor Coleridge and Robert Southey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Wordsworth

questions.question: Also the name of a famous vodka, Finlandia was a symphonic poem first written in 1899 by what Finnish composer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean Sibelius

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Wind and Film
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 2007 the Muslims in the world outnumbered the Christians.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Movie Gone with the Wind was the first feature length film shot entirely in color.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Author Dean Koontz was so upset with the 1996 film version of this book that he has demanded creative control over every film based on one of his books.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hideaway

questions.question: These omnivorous mammals are native to North America. They carry their young for 65 days and give birth to up to five babies. They live up to 16 years, but their average life expectancy is 2 years due to hunting and traffic deaths.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: raccoons

questions.question: Which of these islands is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sicily

questions.question: This Greek philosopher is known for writing about the fabled land of Atlantis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plato

questions.question: What year did the United States boycott the International Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: This singer sang Etta James song A Sunday Kind of Love on the TV show Star Search in 1990. She hosted a 2004 Saturday Night Live episode featuring a Sex and the City parody, where she played Samantha Jones and revealed she was a man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christina Aguilera

questions.question: Relying on a hand crank for power, this gun is considered the first machine gun since it could fire continuously.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gatling gun

questions.question: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) was formed in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1949

questions.question: Shortly after WWII, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention was founded in this city that hosted the 1939 premiere of Gone With the Wind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlanta, GA

questions.question: What is the best selling album of all time in the United States as of 2007?

options.text: Led Zeppelin IV, by Led Zeppelin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eagles Greatest Hits 1971-1975

questions.question: Who or what is Vinson Massif?

options.text: a muscle in the human body

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The tallest mountain in Antarctica

questions.question: This NFL team, established in 1933, plays its home games in Heinz Field. In 2008, ESPN.com ranked this teams fans as the best in the NFL partly due to their sellout streak of 299 consecutive games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pittsburgh Steelers

questions.question: Which one of the Great Lakes is situated entirely within the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Michigan

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Magazine and Chimp
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the 3rd largest city in Germany and the capital of its largest state, Bavaria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Munich

questions.question: This amendment of the United States Constitution, which is part of the Bill of Rights, guards against unreasonable searches and seizures.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fourth Amendment

questions.question: What is the full name of the 33rd US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry S. Truman

questions.question: This word is Sanskrit for Great Soul, and is used like the title Saint. Some believe that it was first used in 1915 when speaking of Ghandi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mahatma

questions.question: When a contestant selects the Daily Double on the game show Jeopardy! what is the least amount the player can wager?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $5

questions.question: This 61* and The Punisher actor was born Thomas Elliott III in Baltimore, MD. He studied at the Lee Strasburg Theatre Institute in Hollywood. He married actress Patricia Arquette in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jane

questions.question: John Travoltas mother appeared in the movie Grease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the 1989 movie Bill  Teds Excellent Adventure, which historical figure do the boys NOT bring back for their history presentation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: A chimp named Laika was the first living mammal to orbit the earth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Gangster Al Capone, popular as Scarface, was known by what other nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snorky

questions.question: Wyoming was the first U. S. state to give women the right to vote.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which country has the highest population density in the world as of 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monaco

questions.question: This Greek goddess, daughter of Zeus and Metis, is the virgin patron of Athens. The Parthenon was built as her temple.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athena

questions.question: Before becoming US President in 1981, he was head of a labor union.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reagan

questions.question: The weekly news magazine Newsweek was launched in 1933. It has a worldwide circulation of over 4 million, and is printed in Japanese, Korean, Arabic, English, Polish, Russian, and Spanish. Where is the magazine published?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Species
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, marvel, porphyrias. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Hebrew word refers to a non-human, speechless, animated being from Jewish folklore.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golem

questions.question: Gollum was a marvel of computer graphics in The Lord of the Rings. What actor gave Gollum his movements?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andy Serkis

questions.question: This American actress and stand-up comedian, host of a syndicated talk show, wrote an autobiography, entitled My Point...And I Do Have One.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellen DeGeneres

questions.question: The cow as white as milk

options.text: d the slipper as pure as gold.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Into the Woods

questions.question: Which movie, directed by Academy Award-winning director, Robert Zemeckis, includes the often quoted line Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what youre gonna get.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forrest Gump

questions.question: In trigonometry this law, which generalizes the Pythagorean theorem, is a statement about a general triangle, which relates the lengths of its sides to the cosine of a known angle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Law of Cosines

questions.question: The best thing about being a woman
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shania Twain

questions.question: Which of these actors made his debut at the age of 5 in a movie written and directed by his father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Downey, Jr.

questions.question: One of the two species, comprising the chimpanzee genus, is the Common Chimpanzee. What is the name of the other species?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bonobo chimpanzee

questions.question: Jonathan Larson based his rock musical on the opera La Boheme. What rock musical about young artists and musicians and their struggle, hopes and fears made it to # 2 on Entertainment Weeklys New Classics List?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rent

questions.question: This Hungarian-Austrian physician demonstrated that puerperal fever (also known as childbed fever) was contagious and that its incidence could be considerably reduced by enforcing appropriate hand washing behavior.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. I. Semmelweis

questions.question: This 1996 game introduced networked play and 3-D graphics. What game introduced or perfected this landmark first person shooter according to Entertainment Weekly?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doom

questions.question: Which of these songs, inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame, was not recorded by the singer-songwriter, born Robert Allen Zimmerman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aint No Mountain High Enough

questions.question: What Victorian poet is the author of Porphyrias Lover, a poem written in the form of a shocking dramatic monologue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Browning

questions.question: It is generally accepted that the name of these islands of volcanic origin derives from a Latin term, meaning Island of the Dogs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Canary Islands

questions.question: Name the Dynasty star featured in the December, 1983 issue of Playboy magazine.

options.text: Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Black Arrow

questions.question: True of False: Jules Vernes real name was Jean-Luc Vernes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Robert De Niro won his first Academy Award for the portrayal of this former boxing champion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jake LaMotta

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Frost

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Tork

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: People

questions.question: On what game show did contestants receive unwanted joke prizes, called zonks?
